dataflowSinks.name: UserQueryAzureSqlTable1
dataflowSinks.script:
sink(allowSchemaDrift: true,
	validateSchema: true,
	input(
		handleId as string,
		fieldType as string,
		name as string,
		description as string,
		productImageUrl as string,
		collection as string,
		sku as string,
		ribbon as string,
		price as decimal(10,2),
		surcharge as decimal(10,2),
		visible as boolean,
		discountMode as string,
		discountValue as decimal(10,2),
		inventory as integer,
		weight as decimal(10,2),
		cost as decimal(10,2),
		productOptionName1 as string,
		productOptionType1 as string,
		productOptionDescription1 as string,
		productOptionName2 as string,
		productOptionType2 as string,
		productOptionDescription2 as string,
		productOptionName3 as string,
		productOptionType3 as string,
		productOptionDescription3 as string,
		productOptionName4 as string,
		productOptionType4 as string,
		productOptionDescription4 as string,
		productOptionName5 as string,
		productOptionType5 as string,
		productOptionDescription5 as string,
		productOptionName6 as string,
		productOptionType6 as string,
		productOptionDescription6 as string,
		additionalInfoTitle1 as string,
		additionalInfoDescription1 as string,
		additionalInfoTitle2 as string,
		additionalInfoDescription2 as string,
		additionalInfoTitle3 as string,
		additionalInfoDescription3 as string,
		additionalInfoTitle4 as string,
		additionalInfoDescription4 as string,
		additionalInfoTitle5 as string,
		additionalInfoDescription5 as string,
		additionalInfoTitle6 as string,
		additionalInfoDescription6 as string,
		customTextField1 as string,
		customTextCharLimit1 as integer,
		customTextMandatory1 as boolean,
		customTextField2 as string,
		customTextCharLimit2 as integer,
		customTextMandatory2 as boolean,
		brand as string
	),
	deletable:false,
	insertable:true,
	updateable:false,
	upsertable:false,
	truncate:true,
	format: 'table',
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: true,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: true,
	errorHandlingOption: 'stopOnFirstError') ~> UserQueryAzureSqlTable1
